meanings.definition: Not offering a friendly or welcoming environment
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house looked inhospitably dark and unwelcoming.
meanings.sent2: The hotel staff were inhospitably cold towards the new guests.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat sat inhospitably on the windowsill, ignoring everyone.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered inhospitably, threatening to ruin the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The old mansion stood inhospitably on top of the hill, casting a shadow over the town.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is not conducive to hosting guests
meanings.sent1: The innkeeper looked at the rowdy group inhospitably, worried about their behavior.
meanings.sent2: The party ended inhospitably early due to a noise complaint.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed inhospitably at the unexpected visitors, demanding attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled inhospitably through the cracks in the cabin, chilling the guests.
meanings.sent5: The rain fell inhospitably, drenching the campers despite their best efforts to stay dry.
